story.text: NEW YORK Jan 2 CheckFree Corp. CKFR.O, a maker of software for online bill paying, said on Tuesday it agreed to buy Carreker Corp. CANI.O for $206 million to expand its services to the financial industry. The terms value Carreker at $8.05 per share, a 5 percent premium over the stock's Friday closing price of $7.64 on Nasdaq. CheckFree expects the purchase to dilute earnings per share in its fiscal 2007 year, which ends June 30, and in fiscal 2008. It expects the transaction to close by March 31, pending shareholder and regulatory approvals. CheckFree is based in Atlanta, and Carreker in Dallas.
story.title: checkfree to buy carreker for $ 206 mln
